X-ref.text: οττι τοι ἐν μεγάροισι κακόντ', ἀγαθόν τε τέτυκται

marginalia.translation: "What evil and what good has been wrought in thy halls."
A new form of improvement, above, below. A new form of irony.

position.marginalia_text: Valet actor, tam iudicio solidus, quàm serius industriâ.

marginalia.translation: An actor is capable when he is as solid in judgment as he is earnest in his industriousness.

position.marginalia_text: Et singula seriò: et ioco omnia: Eutrapeli dexteritas.

marginalia.translation: Both earnestly in singular matters, and jovially in all things: the skillfulness of Eutrapelus.

position.marginalia_text: Nec tanti est ullum negociu[m], vt tristem faciat virum.

marginalia.translation: There is no matter of importance that makes a man sad.

position.marginalia_text: Nec me vnq[uam] uidebit mundus aut ignavum; aut timidum; aut tristem; aut iracundum. }

marginalia.translation: The world will never see me lazy, timid, sad, or angry.

position.marginalia_text: Singula leui pollice: instar Ludi omnia.

marginalia.translation: Doing singular things with a light touch: a model for all games.

position.marginalia_text: Tardè aggredi, frigiditas senilis: non perficere, leuitas puerilis. Et maturè incipere, et perfectè finire, virtus est virilis. Pla[e]riq[ue] omnes, Nuga[e].

marginalia.translation: To undertake something too late, such is the coldness of old age. To fail to accomplish something, such is the fickleness of youth. But to begin at the right moment and to finish something enitrely, such is the virtue of the virile man. The majority of all men are trifles.

position.marginalia_text: Bona Oeconomica facit bonam politicam. Vt charitas; sic prudentia
incipit à Se ipsa. Hodiè mihi: cras tibi.

marginalia.translation: Good economics makes for good politics. As with charity, so too prudence begins from itself. Today is mine, tomorrow is yours.
